instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.message:
got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board looks like it had some slight liquid damage. 
ppbus is 17.85 which is weird.  dunno where to start with this one.

Double check that measurement. If it's 17 volts, then <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> is shorted. Replace the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR>, and <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> at the same time and see what results it yields.

<TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> shorted for sure.
Replace it and check <CAPACITOR>C7025</CAPACITOR>.
Be sure to have good solders and traces for <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
can i take <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR> <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> from a 2011 board?  i don't have an 15" 2012 donor board.

I suppose yes.
Compare datasheet of each component...

replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR> <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
now i have 12.6v  but still no boot.

yes sir, always apple store 85W chargers only :)

i just noticed its 12.6  isn't this gonna be an smc problem?  isn't ppubs suppose to be 12.8?

12.6V is correct value.
Post the basic signals involved in power on sequence.
Also try to start in SMC bypass mode.

12.6V is good value.
Can you post requested signals???
